column5: burke made a statement with that big contract.  he knows he's in toronto for the foreseeable future and likely knows he has to step it up.  and he's got to learn to skate with his head up (as Cherry mentioned) though because some young buck looking to make a name for himself is going to take his head off at some point. sarnia's yakupov is probably the most dominant player i've seen in the ohl in a very long time but he skates sort of like grabo and often puts his head down.  he recently got destroyed by mike halmo of the owen sound attack, and was subsequently suspended for 10 games (silly considering Yakupov puts himself into the awkward position while travelling at a high rate of speed).  i watched yakupov cut across the middle with his head down like this many times this season in the soo.  thankfully for him the porous Soo Greyhound defense was more into poke checks than body checks and he went unmolested.  but every time he cut across the middle i imagined how vulnerable he was to a heavy hit, and repeatedly said to my dad that he'd get killed in the nhl. i hope there was a lesson learned for him. He's a brilliant hockey player. Halmo hit on Yakupov

hey, we were stoked about that win!  the timing was clutch, and we had a rookie netminder in net against the defending champions!  it's not rosy glasses... it's something leaf fans don't know much about... something to celebrate!  you'd think considering that they are playing for their playoff lives, the leafs would have a little more to give.  what a sad hockey team.

What do you know about celebrating when it comes to hockey lol. I hate to say it but I am sure there are some leafs fans here that remember the leafs winning the cup.  I don't know any sens fans that do. Maybe in your future you will but probably not for along time. Remember as yes the leafs play like crap, in the nhl the objective is to win the cup not make it to the playoffs to blow it all in the first round lol.

if you can't watch hockey, and NOT find things to celebrate in your team, then you won't last as a fan. cups that happened in '27, '67, who gives a ...  don't blame me for having optimism in my club about our cup chances (going forward that is, not immediately).  i know it's been a long time for you.

Pens are strong, and I have always been a big fan of crosby. However I am not a jaded hockey fan. I see it for what it is. He looked like a leafer out there. poking at pucks from 6 feet away. Hopefully he listens to Cherry this time and keeps out of the mix or he is gonna be just begging for someone to run him through the boards. New York even looked like they were going easy on him throughout the game. A chop here and there, but noone seemed to want to rub him out. Big mistake letting him get back into the lineup this year, imo. Once the playoffs roll around if he is producing points people aren't going to go easy on him. Especially teams like Boston and New York.
First game back so I thought he did okay. I'm sure he'll work into the flow over time. I hope he can stay healthy. GO PENS!!

Yeah, that was weird.  I didn't catch the end of the game, so I checked the box score on NHL.com and I swore I saw that Sid had 2 assists, and then I looked just now and it says one.  He was up there for 2, I'm sure of it, last night.  Good point on Jedi, as well.  I'm born and raised in southwestern Ontario, Leafs fan my whole life, but beyond that, I'm a hockey fan pure and simple and I like watching talented players and teams play good hockey.  You're just as likely to find me watching a Calgary game or a Pens game as you would a Leafs game (moreso lately, cause the Leafs just plain suck!).  There's no denying Sid is one of the best ever and arguably the best player currently playing.  To come back after missing the last 40 games and still be able to contribute - not sure there's many out there who could do that. And if he can keep his melon intact, it's only going to get better through the rest of the season and post-season.  And yes, I'm starting the "fire Burke" chant, right now .....

Hes got 11 or 12 games to get in game shape, prepare for the playoffs. This will be the most critical time for his come back. If everything goes good, he will be ready. Once the playoffs start it take no prisoners and your name no longer matters.

Hey Dr. Salvelinus, so I'm driving home from work tonight listening to HNIC Radio on my Sirius satellite, and they out of the blue mention that the second assist for Crosby last night has been re-recognized.  Turns out I'm not crazy after all!  They at first said he got his stick on the shot from Letang and deflected it to Dupuis who then scored.  That was his second assist in the 3rd period.  Then, Crosby WASN'T listed in the box score on the assist.  And now, I just checked and he's listed again.  Go figure.  http://www.nhl.com/ice/recap.htm?id=2011021054&navid=sb:recap
